name: mc-bidirectional-cross-asset
description: Bidirectional cross-asset transfers: some USDC→USDT, some USDT→USDC. Net effect depletes USDT on chain2. Rebalancer must identify net deficit, not over-react to both directions.
expectedBehavior:
4 transfers: 3 USDC→USDT (150 USDT demand) + 1 USDT→USDC (50 USDC demand).
USDT: 150 withdrawn, 0 deposited → net -150 vs 100 supply → depleted.
USDC: 50 withdrawn by USDT→USDC, but 150 USDC deposited by USDC→USDT → net surplus.
Rebalancer must supply USDT from inventory (depleted globally) and bridge USDC (distribution imbalance).

defaultStrategyConfig.routeHints:
Available paths:
- rebalance_collateral tool: same-asset cross-chain (USDC chain1↔chain2, USDT chain1↔chain2)
- supply_collateral tool: deposit wallet inventory into any router (same-asset, same-chain instant, cross-chain via bridge)
- mock_lifi_swap tool: swap between assets in your wallet (same-chain, e.g. USDC→USDT)
defaultStrategyConfig.policyProse:
User traffic is BIDIRECTIONAL cross-asset: both USDC→USDT and USDT→USDC transfers.
Don't over-react to both directions — compute NET imbalance per asset.
USDT is net depleted (more outflow than inflow). USDC has surplus from cross-asset deposits.
When USDT is depleted, use supply_collateral from wallet inventory.
For USDC distribution imbalance, use rebalance_collateral.
Check get_inventory and get_balances to assess the situation.
